title: git-annex does not enable autoenable=true special remotes on windows

labels.name: severity-critical
labels.description: makes it unusable, causes data loss, introduces security vulnerability

body:
```
(Pdb) riaclone.siblings()
.: here(+) [git]
.: origin(-) [file:///C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_t_l0fc4o/cb5/d3fcb-1391-4078-9039-0eb6b568c8a1 (git)]
[{'action': 'query-sibling', 'path': 'C:\\Users\\mih\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd', 'type': 'sibling', 'refds': 'C:\\Users\\mih\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd', 'name': 'here', 'annex-uuid': '228ec9f6-99aa-4b8c-a7d2-82f3d23efd75', 'annex-bare': 'false', 'annex-version': '8', 'available_local_disk_space': 459097722304, 'annex-description': 'mih@bnbdatalad:~/AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd', 'status': 'ok'}, 
 {'action': 'query-sibling', 'path': 'C:\\Users\\mih\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd', 'type': 'sibling', 'refds': 'C:\\Users\\mih\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd', 'name': 'origin', 'url': 'file:///C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_t_l0fc4o/cb5/d3fcb-1391-4078-9039-0eb6b568c8a1', 'fetch': '+refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*', 'annex-ignore': True, 'status': 'ok'}]
```

but it is configured

```
(Pdb) riaclone.repo.call_git(['cat-file', '-p', 'git-annex:remote.log'])
'92a38963-5560-4946-b838-5a0f892bb895 archive-id=cb5d3fcb-1391-4078-9039-0eb6b568c8a1 autoenable=false encryption=none externaltype=ora name=store-storage type=external url=ria+file://C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_t_l0fc4o timestamp=1604830435.7646456s\n92a38963-5560-4946-b838-5a0f892bb895 archive-id=cb5d3fcb-1391-4078-9039-0eb6b568c8a1 autoenable=true encryption=none externaltype=ora name=store-storage type=external url=ria+file://C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_t_l0fc4o timestamp=1604830433.2020993s\n'
```

`git annex info` lists it as a not-enabled special remote.

and this is also reported by `repo_info()`

```
(Pdb) riaclone.repo.repo_info(fast=True)
{'untrusted repositories': [], 'semitrusted repositories': [{'here': False, 'uuid': '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001', 'description': 'web'}, {'here': False, 'uuid': '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002', 'description': 'bittorrent'}, {'here': True, 'uuid': '228ec9f6-99aa-4b8c-a7d2-82f3d23efd75', 'description': 'mih@bnbdatalad:~/AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_xyg24gdd'}, {'here': False, 'uuid': '92a38963-5560-4946-b838-5a0f892bb895', 'description': 'store-storage'}, {'here': False, 'uuid': '96cd6ebb-3d28-4415-a7af-d8afc2c0f4cd', 'description': 'mih@bnbdatalad:~/AppData\\Local\\Temp\\datalad_temp_7nhsd9vm\\ds'}], 'input': [], 'transfers in progress': [], 'error-messages': [], 'available local disk space': 459096944064, 'file': None, 'trusted repositories': []}
```

But `get_remotes()` doesn't report it, which in turn causes `siblings()` to exclude it from any report. The reason for that is that is no trace of this special remote in the repo config. And `get_remotes()` only looks into the config.

This breaks `ria` post-clone handling.
